text: Today felt like a time warp in all the best ways. It’s been over a decade since I worked in the enviro advocacy space, but meeting folks in my neighborhood who want to find real solutions to the climate crisis, and actively put their time and money behind making it happen, makes me so, so happy!
The traffic calming committee is working on a paint daylighting project to at least cut down on the parking close to corners, which has been a huge visibility issue.

Proud to have earned the support of the NoVA Labor Federation (AFL-CIO) in my campaign for re-election to City Council! During my time on Council, I've been proud to stand with the working people of Alexandria and the unions who represent them.
Four is the likely max rate increase to be set tonight, IMHO. That leaves room to set the actual rate a bit lower after Add/delete discussions.
Seems like a landlubber comment.  From a deep sea perspective, Hazel would be crushed if she tried to chase Alvin, heaven forfend! 😀
I'm in. I haven't seen the Hunt for Red October since it premiered in Norfolk,  VA at a special showing for U.S. submariners. Happy to share a few stories from that experience and perspective.

I've been honored to serve with Alyia over the two years we've been on Council, and to see how hard she works for the people of our City. I'm proud to both have her support as I run for reelection and to support her campaign for Mayor!
Just needs a refresh with the actual primary date of June 18th!

Delivering for Alexandrians requires teamwork, collaboration, and creativity. Alyia and John are not done working together, and are endorsing each other in their 2024 campaigns - @@2326 and John Taylor Chapman for Alexandria City Council.

Delegate Herring indicated that she would vote For the arena bill to allow conversations to continue and for the bill to improve as it goes through the process. She indicated there are many unknowns (and most of us would agree). Not a surprise for the House Majority Leader.

Shout out to @@2432 who spoke in support  bicycling safety & e-bike incentive bills in Virginia House subcommittee hearings last week of which three passed successfully! Here is an update on bicycling & street safety legislative initiatives in the GA:
www.vabike.org/2024/02/04/v...
Mailers!!! ...  for the Chevy Chase project proposed to include housing with a new library and community center. Mailers!!!  wapo.st/3vPSEIa
Sunrise views from Seminary Road
I am undecided about Pi day, but today is definitely Cookie day!

Thanks @@2326! Everyone in the room was energized after listening to you answer questions on a myriad of topics. Sample comment from a neighbor about Alyia afterwards: "We need to do more of these [events] so all of our friends get to know her; she really knows her stuff."

Hopeful, but show me the money! As recently as yesterday (Thursday), at the House Transportation Comm. meeting, Sec. of Transportation Miller said, "We gave NVTC $100 million in 2021 for Metro that they have not yet allocated to WMATA; we consider that the Commonwealth's contribution for this year"

“Increasingly, elected officials and the public are coming to understand that the societal benefits of offering something to everyone for free (like school lunches) can often outweigh the cost of policing who has access.”

Alexandria streets in the West End that I traveled on Sunday, including residential streets, had been pre-treated in anticipation of Sunday night's snow. I expect the same occurred elsewhere in Alexandria.
One of my family members likes to find a spot in the sun.

Good question Jen. Thanks. Here is a response from DASH Director of Finance & Admin, Edward Ryder, (on the other site):  "We do occasionally do charters, so that might've been it. Charters often involve the trolley, but we do other ones in the area too, not just on the trolley."

Here's a thought exercise: would attitudes be different if you told people you are reducing the number of travel lanes on their street to put in parking spaces versus telling them you are reducing the number of lanes to put in BRT or bike lanes?

BPAC has 2 specific asks on this survey if you haven’t taken it already:

#16 - give option 2 a 5/5 rating
Well deserved endorsements from former leaders!

Honored to receive the endorsement of these two public servants, former Councilmembers Lonnie C. Rich and @@2413! Join me at our campaign kickoff on January 28 - RSVP: alyiaforalexandria.com/event-kickoff
Great to see innovation at DASHBus, e.g.  new route number backgrounds for easier recognition, and larger interior route information displays.

@@2444 I drove by this crash site on Wednesday and saw only damaged motor vehicles. Damage suggested high speeds were involved. Do you have source for indicating this was a "Scooter/bikeshare" crash, or did I misunderstand?

After a year in which the city added only 1/3 of a mile of new bike lanes, staff is poised for much more progress in the FY2024. See page 6 for the FY2024 Complete Streets Work Plan: bit.ly/2024Workplan

What do ALX Skeeters think about e-bike incentives, particularly for people living with low incomes? Wyatt Gordon shares quotes from three ALX Skeeters, including CM @@2432, and other information in this article: www.virginiamercury.com/2024/01/03/a...

Charlotte Achelois Scherer on the old site: twitter.com/Charlotte4ALX Former magistrate & Alexandria resident. Democrat. Passionate about community engagement, affordable housing & inclusive governance. #ALXCityCouncil2024
Great to spend Christmas Eve and Christmas morning with family.
When a broken clavicle means no biking, you can still do Alexandria transportation exploration by taking DASH buses all over.

Note for anyone who might reveal too much about their lives... FYI you can turn it off, but still best to be cautious.
Just had a lovely meeting with Councilman McPike. I appreciate how thoughtful and solution oriented he is. We are lucky to have him on council.

Yesterday, our City Manager and the CEO of the AEDP provided a briefing for City Council and the community on the recently announced proposal for North Potomac Yard.

The presentation included the plan for future engagement.

Providing Virginia's share of short- and long-term funding for WMATA and big $ for committed affordable housing are minimums I expect from members of the General Assembly, particularly NoVA members, if they plan to approve an arena deal.

From the Alex Living Magazine article about @@2442 's Q&A session at DRCA: "There may be 2,500 parking spaces underground for the arena". Looking forward to hearing more about transportation improvements planned with this project! 🙂 alexandrialivingmagazine.com/news/wilson-...
Thanks @@2395 . Good updates.
Looks like Wednesday's DRCA meeting may draw a larger than normal crowd.
Perhaps just add @@2293 to ALX Skeets? @@2428
You will be missed. I hope to see other ALX Skeets friends stop in tonight 6:30 pm to 8:30 pm at the Charles Houston Rec Center.

ALX Skeeters the hottest club in town is the BPAC holiday potluck on Monday at Charles Houston Rec Center. 6:30. Bring a dish and dish some hot takes. This is also your chance to have one of my 8M cookies. No word yet on whether @@2432 is coming but my bet is she bring peppers.

"...former Mayor Allison Silberberg, who says she will not be a candidate for mayor next year"  See Michael Lee Pope's article, "Turnover At City Hall" on page 3 of this week's Alexandria Gazette connectionarchives.com/PDF/2023/120...

I spent like ten minutes this morning staring at Google Maps trying to figure out how an on-foot pursuit in the Landmark area ended up with an arrest at Seminary Road. Kept calling the PIO back saying "I don't get it, explain this to me" and got a kind of funny answer www.alxnow.com/2023/12/07/p...

I’m very happy that Kirk is running for re-election. Well before joining council, he was working towards a better present and future for all of Alexandrians. And on Council, he’s pushed our city to be an even more inclusive and exciting place to live.
The earlier quotes were from the Rosemont Listserve. Sign-up via the link at the bottom of this Listserve home page: groups.io/g/rosemontva

In what other City do residents post questions to their Mayor on a Listserve and receive a thoughtful, respectful, totally wonky (in a good way) responses! We are so appreciative for all that you do @@2442.

It is very exciting to see @@2446 running for re-election to City Council. He has a proven track record and will ensure that the City of Alexandria makes fiscally-sound decisions in the challenging economic times ahead. As @@2445 would say, let's gooooooo!!!!!
Here is @@2395's article reporting @@2326's announcement to run for Mayor www.alxnow.com/2023/12/04/j...
We are ready!

Are you Bike Bus curious?

Join SSAFETY & @@4232657 the first Wed of each month to talk all things bike bus - how to start one, how to help, tips and tricks & all your questions!

Exciting to see Alyia's announcement that she is running for Mayor of the City of Alexandria! Woohoo!
This is how you start a Monday. Gimme my sign, where do I sign up to canvas let’s gooooooo!!!!!

@@2441 - The Alexandria Health Department has a Healthy Homes initiative which includes helping more Alexandria residents live in homes with "clear air". Send an email to healthmatters@vdh.virginia.gov to get involved. More information here: www.alexandriava.gov/health-depar...
Alyia could definitely make it work. I'm ready for that.

Many thanks for the years of leadership and for the year ahead when we know there is more that you will do. We greatly appreciate the time that your family has allowed you to spend doing so so much for everyone in Alexandria. Mille grazie.

@@2447 Great update. If I had known, I would have joined the AFCA meeting! I have a history with both Carter and AFCA. I served on the SHA Board for a number of years including two years with Carter as President. Sad that Carter would ask that question of a guest speaker.
At City Hall for a legislative Town Hall with Alexandria members of the Virginia General Assembly.

Checked my refrigerator door today... There were no city mailers; only family photos and drawings from grandkids. I agree with CM Canek Aguirre observation: most mailers that I go straight to the recycling bin.
Yes to clean and breathable air, drinkable water... and a more sustainable future.

The tables are set. Ready to celebrate a Happy Thanksgiving in Alexandria VA with family and friends.

Shout out to Kevin Brady of Grassroots Alexandria, for speaking up for ZFH, and thanking City Council members for listening to all residents, not just "long-time residents". "If, like me, you support expanding housing opportunities,
please make your voice heard before the November 28
Council vote."

Durham just passed a bundle of zoning reforms and I love it:
www.newsobserver.com/news/local/c...

Cities should be for people, not cars

Durham City Council approves zoning reforms, including eliminating costly parking mandates. "The meeting was tense and chaotic at times, with speakers cynical that council members had already made up their minds."

Read more at: www.newsobserver.com/news/local/c...
Great to see how implementing proven safety measures makes a difference in lives saved and number of injuries from traffic violence reduced.

Great to see the voices of people like Mr. Gomez elevated. www.youtube.com/watch?v=XARW...  Perhaps next find Loren DePina: “Exclusionary zoning and jails are the direct result of abolishing slavery. It’s a new way to keep us ‘over there’ and them ‘over here.'”
Thanks for the article. Have you already set a new personal record for most stories about a single topic in Alexandria? Thanks for helping to keep Alexandrians informed.

Charlotte NC's history is different than Alexandria VA, but similar considerations for increasing housing availability. Notably, Charlotte did not adopt one of the most impactful measures adopted in Minneapolis: eliminating costly parking mandates.  www.theassemblync.com/place/charlo...

City Council members are aware that  the SHA Board represents just the self-perpetuating board and maybe a few dozen other people. Three Council members live in households that Bill claims to represent!
Actually, it is a 17 member Board  with 13 members who are voted in by the in person attendees... 40 people this year; 26 people at last year's annual meeting.

One minor note. The vote tonight was for 13 positions: Pres., VP, Sec., Treas., and 9 area reps. Two more Board members were appointed by their organizations (VTS and EHS). And the Board will elect two at-large reps next month to fill out the 17 member Board.
Correct.
Yes. They elected the 13 member slate presented by their nomination committee.  No change in the top positions. One or two new area reps..
Is @@2432 a real pepper fan or just a bell pepper fan?

At the annual Seminary Hill Assoc. (SHA) meeting with 40  others  (record attendance for a SHA annual mtg) to learn about Z4H from SHA VP Frank P. Facts were mis-used to create fear and angst. I had to leave and apparently missed a Seminary Road update from SHA Pres. Bill R.  SMH.

In my anecdotal experience, city enforcement of reported illegal signs is 100%... every sign in a public right of way that I reported via Alex 311 was removed within 24 hours, most on the same day. Admittedly, all my reports were made on a weekday.

Anna Binneweg was spectacular in her debut as Conductor and Music Director with the Washington Metropolitan Philharmonic on Sunday. We are looking forward to bringing grandchildren with us to the next concert on December 10.

Eliminating parking minimums near  transit corridors is the most impactful change that the Planning Commission can  recommend, and Cuty Council can approve in addition to approving proposed Zoning for Housing initiattives

Anyone else going to the Washington Metropolitan Philharmonic 52nd Season opening concert at the GW Masonic National Memorial today, with Music Director Anna Binneweg (former Alexandria resident & neighbor). If so, please say Hi! www.wmpamusic.org/philharmonic...

Family trips on VRE will be more affordable including on Saturdays if VRE adopts proposed changes. Send an email to publiccomment@vre.org supporting Saturday service and fare simplification, w/ fare free for kids up to 18 in VRE's proposed FY2025 budget. More details here:  susmo.org/vre-fare-inc...

New safety analysis from FHWA for protected bike facilities: "Converting traditional or flush buffered bicycle lanes to a separated bicycle lane with flexible delineator posts can reduce crashes up to 53%" highways.dot.gov/sites/fhwa.d... 
@@2442 @@2432

FHWA's Bicycle Lane Proven Safety Countermeasure document has been revised to incorporate more specific and stronger language about separated bike lanes and their many benefits to users. highways.dot.gov/sites/fhwa.d...
House Salad with... peppers, in Milton DE in honor of @@2432

Getting around by bus gets better starting Sunday, Oct 8, with DASHbus Line 33 Sunday service to run every 30 minutes instead of once/hour, serving Del Ray, Arlandria, Potomac Yard. All DASHbus lines remain Fare Free. Thanks @@2442 @@2432 @@2446
Cheering for my Alma Mater in Annapolis today
Alex- Thanks for attending the Alexandria West SAP meeting. From my experience, the plan will be shaped by those who most consistently show up and speak up. Thanks or doing that.

Having served on the Eisenhower West SAP Adv Comm. (2015), and currently serving on the EW/LVD Implementation AC, the process works reasonably well. The SAP set a 25-yr plan, e.g. for street framework, density & bldg heights, but implementation is piecemeal & depends on market forces.

Did you miss yesterday’s City Council Town Hall meeting? 

You’re in luck, the full video is available online. 

The council covered many topics, including crime, housing and even pickleball! Check it out!:

youtu.be/kUDTqoRYOzw?...
Thanks, Chris. I would greatly appreciate being added to the #MilSky feed and hope to see many other U.S.Navy active duty personnel and veterans here.

PSA: the CDC has a program that pays for your COVID vaccine if your insurer won't. The guy at CVS told me that my insurer had not added the new vaccine to its formulary yet, so I'd need to pay $190. I told him about this program, showed him the website, and paid nothing. 🤗
Freshly mulched and weeded pedestrian refuge medians on Seminary Road today. Oh, ... and the street is traffic free/traffic light except for about 30 minutes three days a week.

DCist reporting: "City planners in Alexandria are recommending that lawmakers eliminate single-family-only zoning, though they estimate that would translate to a meager addition of new housing." t.co/XHJgKv0gn3

Route 102 DASHbus timing was a bit off again today, with arrival at Douglas MacArthur ES at 7:56 AM, later than the 7:50 AM preferred time for him to be in his classroom. So... he's asked to ride a🚲 for the rest of the week. That will work!

Two years ago DASH implemented a Fare-Free program and an initial phase of frequent, all-day service for people in high-density areas. My Op-Ed with Meronne Teklu explains the value of these initiatives and work that remains to be done: alextimes.com/2023/08/cele.... @@2445

My 4th grader grandson has been "transportation shopping" for best ways to get to school at Douglas MacArthur ES on Janneys Lane.  After riding an ACPS school bus, walking and riding his bike, he asked to ride a 102 DASH bus this week .

Today is a big day in Alexandria, as the City begins an extensive period of public engagement on the Zoning for Housing / Housing for All policy package. Tonight, staff will hold a panel discussion to summarize the input received this Spring. 

1/9

A new group opposing our “Zoning For Housing” effort suggests that allowing multi-family residences would “fundamentally change the look and character of Alexandria.” 

So today Kid2 and I decided to drive around (this doubled as new-driver training). Here’s what we found: 

1/10

"...Alexandria...seems to have cracked the code.

The...city delivered the second-most office-to-residential conversions in the country last year, with its 435 converted office-to-residential units placing it just behind Los Angeles’ 692..."

Excellent article that connects land use and transportation and makes a case for restorative approaches for both. "There are plenty of “get out and move” campaigns, but how does one get out and move when there are no sidewalks or paths, no trees to provide shade,..." https://t.co/dhWIBFlbP0?s=09

New bike day! 
When I had a nightmare over vacation that my bike got destroyed, I decided to take the leap and buy this cargo e-bike sight unseen and seat unridden. 
The hills are easier and I can haul so much stuff. I carried 2 CSA's from #SeminaryRd today. This will replace so many car trips!!!!!!

I get that many people don't believe that "Traffic Evaporation" happens, but 20 years of case studies say it is real. "People adjusted their behavior ...

Alexandria’s city council heard from more than 70 residents for and against a bus lane proposal on Duke Street.  Residents were in favor by about a 2-1 margin. https://dcist.com/story/23/06/29/alexandria-city-council-advances-duke-street-bus-lane-project/
